feels.name: Joy
feels.quote: I was their plaything and their idol, and something betterâ€”their child, the innocent and helpless creature bestowed on them by Heaven, whom to bring up to good, and whose future lot it was in their hands to direct to happiness or misery, according as they fulfilled their duties towards me.

feels.name: Gratitude
feels.quote: I distinctly discerned how peculiarly fortunate my lot was, and gratitude assisted the development of filial love.

feels.name: Curiosity
feels.quote: Curiosity, earnest research to learn, and not to learn all things indiscriminately.

feels.name: Enthusiasm
feels.quote: The theory which he attempts to demonstrate and the wonderful facts which he relates soon changed this feeling into enthusiasm.

feels.name: Love
feels.quote: Everyone loved Elizabeth. The passionate and almost reverential attachment with which all regarded her became, while I shared it, my pride and my delight.

feels.name: Hope
feels.quote: The busy stage of life, the virtues of heroes, and the actions of men were his theme; and his hope and his dream was to become one among those whose names are recorded in story as the gallant and adventurous benefactors of our species.

Places.name: Geneva
Places.description: City in Switzerland where Victor Frankenstein and his family resided.

Places.name: Thonon
Places.description: Location near the baths where Victor Frankenstein found a volume of Cornelius Agrippa's works.

Events.id: Being the only child and receiving love and care from his parents
Events.name: Being_the_only_child_and_receiving_love_and_care_from_his_parents
